Nashville — Shownotes S01E03

By:
Mailed on: October 25, 2012

Dear , ,

Dear Cast and Crew of Nashville, S1E03 – “Someday You’ll Call My Name”

Episode synopsis:
Rayna discovers the depth of the financial problems she and Teddy face. Elsewhere, Juliette’s mom comes back into her life; Juliette tempts Deacon with a contract offer; and Scarlett and Gunnar’s shot at stardom is jeopardized.

Original air date:
October 24, 2012

Shownotes:

  • I need to see this tie with horseshoes that a Nashville man can only refer to as having “little U’s”.
  • I do not need to see the side-boob of seventh graders that Rayna’s daughter is referring to.
  • I Will Fall for Scarlett and Gunner pretty darn fast with songs like that.
  • Juliette thinks “processed cheese” is the good stuff. It’s a cheesy metaphor about her music!
  • Why does the Nashville font change at the end of the opening title sequence? Who’s writing the branding standards for this show? Fired!
  • Radio Announcer: “Rayna James cut that track back in 19…” cut off! A lady never reveals the age of her music.
  • Will that beautiful brick archway in the kitchen be enough to hold up Rayana and Teddy’s unstable home life? I say “yes.” 
  • Starts with “Ray”, ends in “Ayna”? Help me out, Juliette. Your code is too elaborate.
  • “Go home. Go the hell. But don’t you stay here.” Aaaaaand storm off!  Perfect Rayna, just like you rehearsed every other episode.
  • Nashville is already covering it’s own songs. If those two girls in the talent show weren’t so damn cute, I might complain.
  • Sounds like your momma was a two-timer too, Rayna. That’ll inspire a song. Maybe even a new one.
  • Rich = driving your car from your house to your own front gate. To see your drug-addict mother.
  • Avery just whisked Scarlett off her feet. Get it? Food processing is a very important metaphor in this episode.
  • Crazy mama drama just got picked up for future episodes, as Juliette’s mom moves in.
  • Someone get props master Tommy Tomlinson to turn Rayna’s final park pose into a statue called “The Over-Thinker”.
  • Someone also tell Tommy Tomlinson his name should be used in the show.
  • Drink every time the line Fade Into You is synced with an editing crossfade in this final montage: Chug! Chug! Chug!…
  • The final cliffhanger is a real nail biter about nail polish. I see what you did there.

Closing comments: Three episodes in, and the show was risking already being a greatest hits version of the first two. But a couple of new tracks by the show’s true singing talents (Sam Palladio and Care Bowen) kept the show feeling like a hit. Is it not painfully obvious that Rayna will go on tour with Juliette and this whole “will he or won’t he” dilemma with Deacon become moot?…

Signed,

Christopher Redmond

Status: (/5)

Arrow — Shownotes S01E01 | The Paperboy
